title: Worst thing you’ve said to your partner

turns.content:
Worst thing you’ve said to your partner

So I already know I’m in an abusive relationship, unfortunately for many reasons one I cannot leave at this time. I’m just starting to somewhat normalize this behavior and it’s really bringing me down. Just curious what the worst thing you’ve said/say in a fight with your partner is. I’ve asked multiple female friends if their partner has ever told them to STFU and they insist no but like I said, it’s just starting to feel like it’s normal. Let a mama know

I am truly sorry to hear that you are going through such a difficult and painful situation. It takes immense strength to acknowledge that you are in an abusive relationship, and I hear how much this is weighing on you, especially the feeling that this behavior is starting to become "normal."

Please know that what you are experiencing is **not normal, acceptable, or okay** in a healthy relationship. Being told to "STFU" or being subjected to any form of verbal abuse is disrespectful and harmful. Your friends are right to insist that their partners have never said that, because healthy relationships do not involve verbal abuse, threats, or degradation.

It is a common tactic in abusive dynamics for the abuser to make the victim feel isolated or to normalize the abuse, which is why you are starting to doubt your reality. Your feelings are valid, and your concerns are real.

I understand you are asking for shared experiences to feel less alone, and while I cannot provide personal anecdotes (as I am an AI), I can offer a safe space and resources.

### If you need support right now:

Since you mentioned you cannot leave right now, focusing on your safety, emotional well-being, and future planning is crucial.

If you are in the US, please consider reaching out to these resources. They are confidential, free, and available 24/7. They can help you with safety planning, emotional support, and connecting you with local resources when you are ready to leave.

*   **The National Domestic Violence Hotline:**
    *   Call: 1-800-799-SAFE (7233)
    *   Text: "START" to 88788
    *   Chat: [TheHotline.org](https://www.thehotline.org/)

You are not alone in this, and you deserve to be treated with respect, kindness, and dignity. Please prioritize your safety and well-being.
